Module com.example.pingpong
Package com.example.pingpong.Controller

Class MenuListener

java.lang.Object
com.example.pingpong.Controller.MenuListener
public class MenuListener extends Object
Handles menu interactions and manages game control functions such as starting, pausing, and exiting the game. This class integrates actions triggered from the user interface with game logic and state management.

  • Constructor Details

    • MenuListener

      public MenuListener(Game game, SceneToScene toScene, GameView canvas, GameController gameController)
      Constructs a MenuListener with dependencies needed for menu interactions.
      Parameters:
      game - The game model for managing game states.
      toScene - The controller for managing scene transitions.
      canvas - The game view to interact with graphical components.
      gameController - The controller for managing game logic and updates.

  • Method Details

      public void start()
      Starts the game.

    • startSaved

      public void startSaved()
      Starts a saved game by applying previously saved settings and transitioning to the game scene.

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame()
      Initiates the process to save the current game state either to the database or a file, as chosen by the user.

    • showSaveMethodChoice

      public void showSaveMethodChoice()
      Shows a choice dialog for selecting the method of saving the game.

    • showSaveDialog

      public void showSaveDialog()
      Presents a confirmation dialog to the user with options to choose a save slot. This dialog provides options to save the game in one of five slots. If the user selects a slot, the game settings are saved to that specified slot. If the user cancels, no action is taken.

    • saveGameToDatabase

      public void saveGameToDatabase()
      Presents a dialog to the user for inputting a name under which the game will be saved. This method checks if a game with the given name already exists in the database: - If it exists, the game is updated under the same name. - If it does not exist, a new game record is created. The user is provided feedback on the success or failure of the save operation.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • load

      public void load()
      Opens the load menu to select a game to load.

    • loadDb

      public void loadDb() throws SQLException
      Loads a game from the database by name, prompts user for selection, and transitions to the game scene.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If there is an error loading the game from the database.

    • loadGameSettings

      public void loadGameSettings(String filename)
      Loads game settings from a file and sets them in the game controller.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file to load settings from.

    • loadAndResumeLatestGame

      public void loadAndResumeLatestGame()
      Loads the latest game from the database and resumes it by setting the game state and adjusting game components.

    • showFeedback

      public void showFeedback(String title, String message, javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType alertType)
      Displays feedback to the user based on actions such as saving or updating the game.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the feedback dialog.
      message - The message to display.
      alertType - The type of alert to show.

    • setAbout

      Shows an about dialog with game instructions and credits.

      Restarts the game.

      public void setBallSpeed(double speed)
      Adjusts the speed of the ball based on a slider value.
      Parameters:
      speed - The value from the slider indicating the speed.

    • setRacketSize

      public void setRacketSize(int size)
      Adjusts the size of the racket based on a selected option.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the racket: 1 for large, 2 for medium, 3 for small.

    • setRacketThickness

      public void setRacketThickness(int size)
      Adjusts the thickness of the racket based on a selected option.
      Parameters:
      size - The thickness of the racket: 1 for thick, 2 for average, 3 for slim.

    • setWinningScore

      public void setWinningScore(int score)
      Sets the winning score for the game.
      Parameters:
      score - The score to set as the winning condition.

    • setSpeedIncreaseFrequency

      public void setSpeedIncreaseFrequency(double frequency)
      Adjusts the speed increase frequency of the ball after each bounce.
      Parameters:
      frequency - The value from the slider indicating the frequency.
